fields.description:
{code}
OS user: user3
kerberos user: hdfs
Reducer is trying to read the map intermediate output using kerberos user(hdfs),but the owner of this file is OS user(user3)

fields.summary: Reduce phase is failing with shuffle error in kerberos enabled cluster

comments.body: Is it mandatory to have the OS user and kerberos users with same name

I guess if you use LinuxContainer and create local user accounts then there will be no problem. I think this issue is caused by  MAPREDUCE-5208 which now enforces user to use LinuxContainer instead of DefaultContainer when setup  security mode.

Hi [~ramgopalnaali] For the different users to run in the Kerberos set up, LinuxContainerExecutor should be used. For more detailed security set up , kindly refer [Hadoop In Security Mode | http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/current/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/SecureMode.html]
